de.uniol.inf.is.odysseus.aalso.model
Class SimulationData

java.lang.Object
  de.uniol.inf.is.odysseus.aalso.model.SimulationData
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectorySimulationData, JarSimulationData
public abstract class SimulationData
extends java.lang.Object

The subclasses of SimulationData encapsulate the simulation information, including the agent, world and context models, the configuration file, the image maps and the sprites. They provide an easy interface to retreive all the information. In order to get your SimulationData object, get an instance of the subclass by passing the path string to the getInstance method. Currently, only a folder or a jar file is supported. TODO:Document the jar/folder structure

Author:
Miquel Martin

Method Detail

getInstance

public static SimulationData getInstance(java.lang.String pathString)
Get an instance of the right subclass of SimulationData by taking the path to the simulation data as parameter.

Parameters:
pathString - the absolute path to the simulation data, currently, a jar file or a folder
Returns:
a SimulationData instance of the right subclass

getAgentModelClass

public java.lang.Class<? extends BaseAgentModel> getAgentModelClass()
Get the AgentModel using the class loader set to the simulation data path.

Returns:
the AgentModel for this simulation

getContextModelClass

public java.lang.Class<? extends BaseContextModel> getContextModelClass()
Get the ContextModel using the class loader set to the simulation data path.

Returns:
the ContextModel for this simulation

public java.lang.Class<? extends BaseWorldModel> getWorldModelClass()

Returns:
the WorldModel for this simulation

getPlaceFiles

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.io.InputStream> getPlaceFiles()
Get the image files from the Simulation Data which represent places. This files are in fact a white image with black dots wherever a place should be created.

Returns:
a Map of with a name-file pair per place type

getOverlayFiles

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.io.InputStream> getOverlayFiles()
Get the image files from the Simulation Data which represent overlays. An overlay is an image map with a value for each position from the map.

Returns:
a Map of with a name-file pair per overlays

getSprites

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.io.InputStream> getSprites()
Get the sprites of the size given as a parameter.

Returns:
a map with the filename-InputStream pair per sprite image

getSpriteNames

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSpriteNames()
Get the names of the sprites available in the simulation.

Returns:
a map with the filename-InputStream pair per sprite image

getWallsFile

public java.io.InputStream getWallsFile()
Retrieve from the simulation data an InputStream for the image that represents the walkable areas (white) and the walls (black) in the simulated world.

Returns:
the InputStream for the image file with the walls

getBackgroundFile

public java.io.InputStream getBackgroundFile()
Retrieve from the simulation data an InputStream for the image that represents the background (white) and the walls (black) in the simulated world.

Returns:
the InputStream for the image file with the background

getConfigFile

public org.apache.commons.configuration.XMLConfiguration getConfigFile()
Get an InputSream linked to the simulation configuration file.

Returns:
the inputstream with the configuration
